Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 339; Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988 TP 333.5.
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, Lespistre de Cupide, adapted from Christian de Pisan — sixty-eight stanzas rhyme royal. For three extracts in London, British Library Addit. 17492 [Devonshire], see 6779, 2697, and 2079.5.

BodArcSelB24.First Lines:
Cupido vnto quhois commandementThe gentill kynred of goddis
                    onely…
BodArcSelB24.Last Lines:
…The ȝere of god Ioyfull and IocundA thousand foure
                    hundreth & secund
BodArcSelB24.Facsimiles:
Boffey,  Julia,  and  A. S. G. Edwards, eds.  
             Chaucer, Works. Bodleian Library MS Arch Selden B.24: Facsimile
                Edition.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1995.

Bod638.First Lines:
Cvpide vnto whos commaundementThe gentill kynrede of goddis an
                    hye…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…The yere of grace ioifull & iocundeA thousand & foure
                    hondrid & secounde
Bod638.Attributed Title:
The Lettre Of Cupide god of Loue (f. 38v); The Lettre of Cupyde
                    (RT); Explicit the Lettre of Cupide god of loue directide to his suggestys
                    louers (f. 45v)
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.

BodDig181.First Lines:
To hire name ȝhit is it no reprefeffor all to vertu was
                    þat she wrowght…
BodDig181.Last Lines:
…The yeer of grace ioyfull and iocoundeA thowsand foure
                    hundred the secunde
BodDig181.Note:
Begins imperfectly due to lost first leaf; stanzas
                    disarranged.
BodDig181.Attributed Title:
Explicit littera Cupidinis directa Subditis suis Amatoribus (f.
                        6v)

CULFf16.First Lines:
Cupido vnto whos commaundementThe gentil kynred of goddes an
                    hyeAnd peple infernall bene obedyentAnd al mortell folke seruen
                    besely…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…Thus thei despised ben on euery sydeAnd sclaundred and blowne
                    on full wyde
CULFf16.Attributed Author: by Chaucer or Occleve (added by later hand, f. 71)
CULFf16.Attributed Title:
Incipit littera Cupidinis de Amoris direta suis subditis amatoribus
                    (f. 71)
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Cvpido vn to whas commaundementesþe gentil kynrede of goddes
                    on hyeAnd people infernal been obedyentAnd alle mortel folk serve
                    besely…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Þe yeere of grace Ioyefull and iocoundeA thousande foure
                    hundreþe yeres and secound
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Nowe here filowing beginneþe a lytel traytis made and compyled by
                    Thomas Occleue of þoffice of þe priue seel specifying þe maners
                    and þe conuersacions booþe of men and wymmen conuersantes in þis
                    lytell yle of Albyone (p. 116); A Gode Parable made by Occleue (RT)

Banna.First Lines:
Cupeid vnto quhois commandimentThe gentill kinreid of the goddis sa
                    hye…
Banna.Last Lines:
…The ȝeir of grace Ioyfull and IocoundA thowsand four
                    hundreth and the secound
